summary: This is an email exchange between prosecutors discussing a draft opposition to Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to sever perjury counts from her criminal case. The email includes legal strategy comments comparing the case to precedent (Pomotis) and suggesting alternative arguments using Ruiz and/or Broccolo cases.

keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively working on opposing Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to sever perjury counts from her criminal case in February 2021.
The legal discussion references case precedents including Pomotis, Ruiz, and Broccolo to strengthen arguments against severance.

The prosecutors note that Maxwell's own arguments in support of suppression motions could be used against her, specifically that 'the risk of criminal prosecution was on her mind at the time of the depositions.'
The correspondence reveals ongoing legal strategy discussions between prosecutors in the Maxwell case.
The document shows the prosecution's concern about 'over-relying' on the Pomotis precedent and considering alternative legal approaches.
